skill.name: opentrons-integration
skill.description: Official Opentrons Protocol API for OT-2 and Flex robots. Use when writing protocols specifically for Opentrons hardware with full access to Protocol API v2 features. Best for production Opentrons protocols, official API compatibility. For multi-vendor automation or broader equipment control use pylabrobot.
skill.summary: Official Opentrons Protocol API for OT-2 and Flex robots. Use when writing protocols specifically fo...
skill.author: K-Dense-AI

security_audit.summary: The static analysis findings are false positives. The detected 'external_commands' are actually backticks in markdown documentation tables showing API method signatures. The 'weak cryptographic algorithm' findings are from example code comments and documentation, not actual cryptographic implementations. This is a legitimate lab automation skill for Opentrons robots.

content.user_title: Automate lab workflows with Opentrons robots
content.value_statement: Writing lab automation protocols requires specialized knowledge of robotics APIs and liquid handling procedures. This skill provides ready-to-use templates and comprehensive guidance for creating protocols that control Opentrons liquid handling robots.
actual_capabilities: Generate complete Opentrons Protocol API v2 scripts
Create liquid handling protocols for OT-2 and Flex robots
Design PCR setup workflows with thermocycler control
Implement serial dilution and plate replication protocols
limitations: Only supports Opentrons hardware (not multi-vendor setups)
Requires Python Protocol API v2 knowledge

use_cases.title: Automate PCR setup
use_cases.description: Create protocols for setting up PCR reactions with master mix distribution and thermocycler programming

use_cases.title: Perform serial dilutions
use_cases.description: Generate accurate serial dilution protocols across 96-well plates for assay development

use_cases.title: Control multiple modules
use_cases.description: Integrate temperature, magnetic, and heater-shaker modules in complex workflows

prompt_templates.title: Basic protocol structure
prompt_templates.scenario: Create a simple liquid transfer protocol
prompt_templates.prompt: Write an Opentrons protocol that transfers 100ÂµL from well A1 to B1 using a P300 pipette

prompt_templates.title: PCR setup workflow
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a protocol for setting up 24 PCR reactions with master mix and DNA samples using the thermocycler

prompt_templates.title: Serial dilution series
prompt_templates.prompt: Write a protocol for 1:2 serial dilutions across a 96-well plate row, starting with 200ÂµL stock

prompt_templates.title: Multi-module integration
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a protocol using temperature module for sample incubation at 37Â°C followed by magnetic bead separation

output_examples.input: Create a protocol for plating bacterial cultures from a 12-well reservoir to a 96-well plate
output: - P300 single-channel pipette on left mount
- 50ÂµL transfer from each reservoir well to plate columns

best_practices: Always simulate protocols before running on actual hardware
Use meaningful labels for labware to simplify troubleshooting
Include protocol comments for complex steps and timing requirements
anti_patterns: Hardcoding absolute positions instead of using well references
Mixing different API levels within the same protocol
Forgetting to account for tip consumption in long protocols

faq.question: What's the difference between OT-2 and Flex?
faq.answer: Flex is the newer model with expanded deck capacity and different pipette naming conventions. Use robotType in requirements to specify.

faq.question: How do I handle viscous liquids?
faq.answer: Adjust flow rates with pipette.flow_rate.aspirate/dispense and use slower speeds for accurate transfers.

faq.question: Can I use custom labware?
faq.answer: Yes, use load_labware_from_definition() with JSON labware definitions created in Opentrons Labware Creator.

faq.question: How do I pause for manual steps?
faq.answer: Use protocol.pause('Message') to halt execution until user resumes, or protocol.delay() for timed waits.

faq.question: What's the latest API version?
faq.answer: API Level 2.19 is current as of 2024. Always specify the latest stable version in your protocol metadata.

faq.question: How do I optimize tip usage?
faq.answer: Use new_tip='once' for multiple transfers from same source, and return_tip() to reuse tips within a protocol.
